com.redhat.rhn.domain.server
Class ServerFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.common.hibernate.HibernateFactory
      com.redhat.rhn.domain.server.ServerFactory

public class ServerFactory
extends HibernateFactory

ServerFactory - the singleton class used to fetch and store com.redhat.rhn.domain.server.Server objects from the database.

lookupByIdsAndUser

public static java.util.List<Server> lookupByIdsAndUser(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> serverIds,
                                                        User user)
Looks up server objects from the given list of server IDs. If more than 1000 servers are present in the list we'll split it into chunks as this can cause problems on Oracle.

Parameters:
serverIds - List of server IDs.
user - who wants to lookup the Server
Returns:
list of server objects

findVirtPlatformHostsByOrg

public static java.util.List findVirtPlatformHostsByOrg(Org org)
This methods queries for servers, in the specified Org, that have the virtual platform entitlement, and for the count of their registered guests. A set of HostAndGuestView objects is returned.

Parameters:
org - The Org to search in
Returns:
A set of HostAndGuestView objects representing all the virtual host and a count of their registered guests.
See Also:
HostAndGuestCountView

findVirtHostsExceedingGuestLimitByOrg

public static java.util.List findVirtHostsExceedingGuestLimitByOrg(Org org)
Queries for servers, in the specified org, that have the virtual host entitlement and have exceeded their guest limit. A set of HostAndGuestView objects is returned.

Parameters:
org - The org to search in
Returns:
A set of HostAndGuestView object representing all hosts exceeding their guest limit.
See Also:
HostAndGuestCountView

listUngroupedSystems

public static java.util.List<Server> listUngroupedSystems(User user)
List systems that are not in a ServerGroup The query would (hopefully) return Server objects, but due to the parent child relationship of Server to SpacewalkServer and ProxyServer, hibernate won't properly return all the Servers

Parameters:
user - the user, who's accessible servers will be returned.
Returns:
A list of servers

Returns:
a list of Proxy Server objects

listSystemsInSsm

public static java.util.List<Server> listSystemsInSsm(User user)
Returns a list of Server objects currently selected in the System Set Manager. This list will not contain servers that are proxies.

Parameters:
user - User requesting.
Returns:
List of servers.

listConfigEnabledSystems

public static java.util.List<Server> listConfigEnabledSystems()
Returns a global multi org spanning list of servers that are config enabled. Basically used by taskomatic.

Returns:
a list of config enabled systems

listConfigDiffEnabledSystems

public static java.util.List<Server> listConfigDiffEnabledSystems()
Returns a global multi org spanning list of servers that are config-diff enabled. Basically used by taskomatic.

Returns:
a list of config-diff enabled systems

listSnapshots

public static java.util.List<ServerSnapshot> listSnapshots(Org org,
                                                           Server server,
                                                           java.util.Date startDate,
                                                           java.util.Date endDate)
List snapshots associated with a server. A user may optionally provide a start and end date to narrow the snapshots that will be listed. For example, - If user provides startDate only, all snapshots created either on or after the date provided will be returned - If user provides startDate and endDate, all snapshots created on or between the dates provided will be returned - If the user doesn't provide a startDate and endDate, all snapshots associated with the server will be returned.

Parameters:
org - the org doing the request. Required.
server - the server to check for. Required.
startDate - the start date. Optional, unless endDate is provided.
endDate - the end date. Optional.
Returns:
list of ServerSnapshot objects

lookupSnapshotById

public static ServerSnapshot lookupSnapshotById(java.lang.Integer id)
Looks up a server snapshot by it's id

Parameters:
id - the snap id
Returns:
the server snapshot

saveSnapshot

public static void saveSnapshot(ServerSnapshot snapshotIn)
Save a server snapshot

Parameters:
snapshotIn - snapshot to save

deleteSnapshot

public static void deleteSnapshot(ServerSnapshot snap)
Delete a snapshot

Parameters:
snap - the snapshot to delete

deleteSnapshots

public static void deleteSnapshots(Org org,
                                   java.util.Date startDate,
                                   java.util.Date endDate)
Delete snapshots across servers in the org. A user may optionally provide a start and end date to narrow the snapshots that will be removed. For example, - If user provides startDate only, all snapshots created either on or after the date provided will be removed - If user provides startDate and endDate, all snapshots created on or between the dates provided will be removed - If the user doesn't provide a startDate and endDate, all snapshots associated with the server will be removed.

Parameters:
org - the org doing the request. Required.
startDate - the start date. Optional, unless endDate is provided.
endDate - the end date. Optional.

deleteSnapshots

public static void deleteSnapshots(Org org,
                                   Server server,
                                   java.util.Date startDate,
                                   java.util.Date endDate)
Delete snapshots associated with a server. A user may optionally provide a start and end date to narrow the snapshots that will be removed. For example, - If user provides startDate only, all snapshots created either on or after the date provided will be removed - If user provides startDate and endDate, all snapshots created on or between the dates provided will be removed - If the user doesn't provide a startDate and endDate, all snapshots associated with the server will be removed.

Parameters:
org - the org doing the request. Required.
server - the server to check for. Required.
startDate - the start date. Optional, unless endDate is provided.
endDate - the end date. Optional.

Parameters:
snap - the snapshot to get tags for
Returns:
list of tags

Filter out a list of systemIds with ones that are solaris systems

Parameters:
systemIds - list of system ids
Returns:
list of system ids that are solaris systems

listLinuxSystems

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Long> listLinuxSystems(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Long> systemIds)
Filter out a list of systemIds with ones that are linux systems (i.e. not solaris systems)

Parameters:
systemIds - list of system ids
Returns:
list of system ids that are linux systems
